content:
reason from such moral premises.
It should be clear that none of these methods of interpretation is mechan-
ical, and none guarantees a single best interpretation of every statute. Part
of the legal controversy is often over which factors can or should be used to
argue for an interpretation. When all is said and done, legal reasoning from
statutes is often far from the straightforward deduction that it appears to be
in simple cases.
